info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 23 at 3:53PM MST by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...SNOW SHOWERS WILL AFFECT WASHINGTON...SOUTHWESTERN KANE AND SOUTH CENTRAL IRON COUNTIES... At 350 PM MST...Moderate to locally heavy snow showers along a line extending from 17 miles south of Hatch to 17 miles west of Gunlock State Park...and moving south at 20 mph. Locations impacted include... Zion National Park, St George, Washington, Hurricane, Santa Clara, La Verkin, New Harmony, Dameron Valley, Quail Creek State Park, Sand Hollow State Park, Gunlock State Park, Apple Valley, Ivins, Hildale, Toquerville, Leeds, Virgin, Springdale, Kanarraville and Rockville. This includes the following highways... Interstate 15 between mile markers 1 and 48. Utah Route 18 between mile markers 0 and 34. * winds in excess of 25 mph are possible with these showers. * visibilities will drop quickly to less than a half mile in these showers. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time when traveling.
